title: Lloyds Bank customers’ details stolen
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Lloyds Bank customers’ details stolen The missing device was stolen from a facility owned by RSA, the insurance company Corbis James Dean Published 1 minute ago 
The personal and financial information of thousands of Lloyds Bank customers is feared to have been stolen after a hard drive went missing from a data centre. 
The missing device was stolen from a facility owned by RSA, the insurance company. It contained the names, addresses and bank account details of Lloyds TSB Premier Account holders who had claimed on RSA home emergency policies bundled with their accounts between 2006 and 2012. 
Police from the regional organised crime unit are investigating the suspected theft, which took place in July but did not emerge until yesterday. The information commissioner is also Subscribe now
